# Functions included in the package
## ARsim( )
The function ARsim() draws from the random variable, which is specified by the density f, using acceptance rejection sampling. 
The default proposal density is the exponential density with rate 1. If you want to use a different density you have to set the argument "exponential" to FALSE and specify your new proposal density and the corresponding inverse distribution function.

## inv_sample( )
The function inv_sample() draws from the random variable, which is specified by the distribution F, using inverse sampling. 

## int( )
The function int() performs a Monte Carlo integration of the function f.

## plot.AR( )
The function plot.ARs() plots the target vs. the proposal density and the empirical vs. the theoretical density of the samples.

## plot.copula( )
plot.copula() plots a 2 dimensional copula, using empirical CDF.

## plot.invsample( )
The function plot.invsample() plots the empirical distribution function of the sampled values

## plot.MC_integral( )
The function plot.MC_integral plots the integrand of a corresponding MC integration 

## plot.simulation( )
Generates the plot of the mean and confidence interval.

## rbi_norm( )
Generates a bivariate normal distribution

## Simulation_analysis( )
Creates a simple PDF analysis for a simulation vector. PDF is saved in current working directory

## summary.AR( )
Summary method for acceptance rejection sampling

## summary.invsample( )
Summary method for inverse sampling

## summary.MC_integral( )
Summary method for Monte Carlo integrals

## summary.simulation( )
Returns a list of mean, variance, relative error and confidence interval.
